oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Confederate belt buckle
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This Confederate belt buckle with raised letters "C.S.A." was found at Anthony Hill in Giles County (Tenn.) in 1986. This style of belt plate was particularly common in the Army of Tennessee. Examples have been recovered from multiple Atlanta Campaign and Tennessee Campaign sites. Plates of this type were probably manufactured at the Atlanta Arsenal.
